alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fentress; Overton; Pickett (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Clay, Fentress, Overton and Pickett. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving across the area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen quickly with these storms in the past hour. With grounds saturated from the 1 to 3 inches of rain that fell earlier today, minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Livingston, Jamestown, Celina, Byrdstown, Allardt, Dale Hollow Lake, Standing Stone State Park, Pall Mall, Pickett State Park and Moss. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
